user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of process_param__epoll:
```c
static enum PerfRepl_param_result
process_param__epoll (const char *param_name)
{
  if (tool_params.poll)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-p' or '--poll'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  if (tool_params.select)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-s' or '--select'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  tool_params.epoll = ! 0;
  return '-' == param_name[1] ?
         PERF_RPL_PARAM_FULL_STR :PERF_RPL_PARAM_ONE_CHAR;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (tool_params.poll)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-p' or '--poll'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Given only the fragment, there is no evidence that the 'if (tool_params.poll) { ... return; }' block is unreachable — its execution depends on the runtime value of tool_params.poll, so Rule 2.1 is not violated. (However, a violation would occur if tool_params.poll were known at compile-time to be a constant: e.g. if it is always false the 'if' body is unreachable; if it is always true the code after the return becomes unreachable.)
